scene.name: intro
scene.line: Here's the charring yard. Vents pretty well, considering.
This smell ... this is why they call Bourbon a comfort food.

scene.name: smells-nice
scene.line: Have you ever been in a forest after a fire?
scene.option: I've been in a house after a fire.

scene.name: drove-by
scene.line: You may have had the windows up. You'd remember. When live trees burn, the air is laden with a syrupy ash. If you touch it, it breaks apart like a snowflake.

scene.name: house-fire
scene.line: Well, every narcotic has a breath of homesickness on it. That's what makes it so damned compelling.

scene.name: empty-coffins
scene.line: What? Oh, of course. We don't really exhume them anymore. We tapped that source years ago.
